Many customers are justifiably upset with this DVD having just four episodes of the original TV series (and one bonus episode from the 2006 first season of Shaggy & ScoobyDoo Get a Clue!). Personally, I purchased this singledisc release years ago expressly to acquire Spooky Space Kook, which was a childhood favorite.

A Child of the Sixties, who grew up on ScoobyDoo, Ive always found entertainment in shows like Kolchak: The Night Stalker, Night Gallery, Amazing Stories, Tales from the Dark Side, XFiles, Buffy (thats right, I said it, the Vampire Slayer rocked) _ and more recently _ Eureka, Warehouse 13, Torchwood, Fringe, Grimm & Supernatural.

Last week, season 13 of Supernatural offered a wonderfully entertaining installment featuring the liveaction Winchester brothers (and Castiel) getting drawn into the animated mystery A Night of Fright is No Delight (1969). The creators produced a magnificent onehour show capturing both the flavor of the old cartoon & the spirit of the newer Supernatural. If you're a Scooby fan, you really should check it out. DVD Contents:

Episodes:
01. Which Witch is Which  (Season One/1969/Episode 13)
02. Go Away Ghost Ship  (Season One/1969/Episode 15)
03. Spooky Space Kook  (Season One/1969/Episode 14)
04. A Night of Fright is No Delight  (Season One/1969/Episode 16)

Special Features:
* Lightning Strikes Twice Bonus Episode  (Season One/2006/Episode 06)
* Youre a Good Man, Charlie Brown Trailer
* Hot Wheels: Battle Force 5 Trailer
* ScoobyDoo and the Samurai Sword Trailer
Over ten dollars for 4 episodes that are on the second and 3rd disc of the original season. Save your money and buy the whole collection.

I don't dislike the shows and the seller was great, but, these are just four episodes from season one. I was looking for season four so this said volume four. Not the same at all .  Bummer. I really don't know that their was a season four of the classic Scooby doo.
Scooby Doo is one of my favorite cartoons, and I love the compilation this has.
